intro: Lyprolepis, commonly known as the rock cress, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Brassicaceae. These plants are typically small herbs with simple, alternate leaves and small, cruciform flowers. They are often found in rocky or arid environments, showcasing their adaptability to harsh conditions. Lyprolepis species are characterized by their capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. The genus includes several species, some of which are used in horticulture for their ornamental value.
